info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 9:40PM MST until July 17 at 11:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...In Holbrook and surrounding areas.
* WHEN...Until 1130 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick roads and muddy unpaved roads. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 940 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Leroux Wash, Little Colorado River, Fivemile Wash and Puerco River. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Holbrook, Sun Valley, Lisitzky Subdivision, Clearview Heights, Holbrook Municipal Airport, Hunt Park and Rosedale Heights. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 286 and 294. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 286 and 289. State Route 77 between mile markers 387 and 397. Highway 180 between mile markers 308 and 312. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MST THIS EVENING
